title: Make the chatbot UI mobile-accessible (responsive + touch-friendly)

requirements.text: Make the main layout responsive so the chat experience is fully usable on phones and tablets, including proper handling of the authenticated chat history panel.

quotes: Can you make it accessible for mobile too

acceptanceCriteria: On small screens (e.g., 320â€“480px wide), the app content fits without horizontal scrolling.

When authenticated, the chat history sidebar does not permanently consume screen width on mobile; it is hidden behind a toggle (e.g., drawer/sheet) or collapses, and the user can still create/select/delete chats from it.
Header actions (Safety & Usage, Clear Chat when present, Sign in/out) remain reachable on mobile (wrap to multiple lines or move into an overflow menu) without overlapping/clipping.
The messages list and composer remain usable on mobile: messages area scrolls independently and the composer stays accessible at the bottom without being pushed off-screen.

requirements.text: Improve mobile ergonomics and accessibility for touch devices across the chat UI (composer, buttons, dialogs).

quotes: Can you make it accessible for mobile too

acceptanceCriteria: Primary interactive targets used frequently on mobile (send button, new chat, chat row tap area, sign in/out) meet a touch-friendly minimum size and spacing (at least ~44px tap target).
Text input is comfortable on mobile: the textarea and send button do not overflow the viewport and remain visible when the on-screen keyboard is open.
Dialogs (e.g., Safety & Usage, delete chat confirmation) render within the viewport on mobile with scrollable content when needed, and no content is cut off.

requirements.text: Ensure the UI uses mobile-safe sizing and spacing throughout the main containers (header/main/footer) and chat area widths.

quotes: Can you make it accessible for mobile too

acceptanceCriteria: The main chat column max width and padding adapt to small screens (reduced side padding, no forced max-width that causes cramped layout).
The chat message bubbles and avatars scale appropriately on mobile (no clipped avatars, no unreadably small text).
No fixed-width container (e.g., the chat history panel width) causes layout breakage on narrow screens.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only Shadcn components); compose/wrap them instead.
Keep the existing Safety & Usage disclosure, Developer Safety Note, chat history, autosave, and Internet Identity login/logout behavior intact.
Do not introduce new backend canisters/services; this request should be satisfied with frontend-only changes.
nonGoals: Adding new chatbot capabilities or changing content/safety policy behavior.
